intro: Galium runcinatum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium runcinatum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
